LangChain is an open-source framework designed to simplify the development of applications powered by large language models (LLMs).
It supports integrations with vector stores like FAISS and retrievers such as BM25.
LangChain allows you to chain LLMs with external tools, databases, and APIs.
For document retrieval, dense vector retrievers often outperform sparse BM25 in semantic tasks, though hybrid approaches yield better results overall.
LangChain also supports memory, agents, and prompt templating for more advanced pipelines.
Hybrid retrieval combines the semantic power of dense embeddings with the keyword precision of sparse methods.
